ej,kramj101,P,weafh901,Call at 1B (Bumped umpire) $Close play at first with pitcher Jack Kramer covering; when 1B umpire Hal Weafer called Hal Wagner safe, Kramer charged at him, was ejected and threw the ball over the grandstand; in the meantime, Rudy York and Dom DiMaggio crossed the plate during the argument; DiMaggio was sent back to third base by HP umpire Passarella,which caused Boston manager Joe Cronin to protest strongly, but the call stood; no further ejections1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

ej,trucv101,P,romme101,Fan interference non-call (Threw water bucket) $Ted Williams lifted a high foul near the 3B stands; George Kell reached into the stands to make the catch but a fan took the ball away; the Tigers argued for fan interference but 3B umpire Jim Boyer disagreed; bats, towels and buckets came flying out of the Tigers dugout; Virgil Trucks ejected by 1B umpire Eddie Rommel1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

$Ted Williams hit three home runs and drove in eight runs in the first game of the day; after Williams doubled in the second, Indians manager Lou Boudreau decided to use an unorthodox defensive alignment against Williams; Boudreau placed six fielders on the right side of the field, leaving only left fielder George Case on the left side of the diamond' this is the first time that the shift had been used against Ted Williams, but it resembled one used against Cy Williams in the 1920s1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
Ground ball through SS position beating the Williams shift1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
$As DiMaggio stole, the pitch to Williams was high and tight bringing a warning from HP umpire Red Jones1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

ej,hodgr101,P,joner901,Bench jockeying ej,lodid101,P,summb901,Bench jockeying ej,smite105,P,summb901,Bench jockeying ej,millb110,C,summb901,Bench jockeying ej,welll101,P,joner901,Bench jockeying $Four Chicago players: Hodgin, Lodigiani, Smith, and Wells plus coach Miller were ejected by HP umpire Jones and 3B umpire Summers for arguing about the warning Jones had given Haynes after his close pitch to Williams the previous inning1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
pbp account ends here, rest deduced1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

$Criticism of Jones continued from the Chicago bench and he ordered the 9 remaining players to the clubhouse, but they were eligible to be recalled onto the field; none were recalled; players in the bullpen were not sent to the clubhous; these 9 are not counted as ejections; they were Rigney, Tresh, Trosky, Curtright, Lopat, Whitman, Platt, Liebhart, and Moses; Liebhart was a batting practice pitcher, not an active player1946BOS.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
